name: Angular
description: together with React and Vue.js one of the three most popular JavaScript frameworks

name: CI/CD
description: the combined practices of continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD)

name: React
description: currently the most popular front-end JavaScript framework along with Vue and Angular

name: Swagger
description: a suite of tools for API developers created in 2011

name: REST
description: a way to make services on a web available to software and other websites

name: GitLab
description: a popular tool to organize the lifecyle of software development - a local GitHub

name: UX
description: how a user interacts with and experiences a software application including the person's perceptions of utility, ease of use, and efficiency

name: Testing
description: 1. unit tests, 2. integration tests, 3. end-to-end tests

name: Bootstrap
description: a ubiquitous CSS framework that simplifies website design

name: styled-components
description: the best bits of ES6 and CSS to style your React app components without stress

name: Storybook
description: a tool for UI development that makes development faster and easier by isolating components

name: FuseBox
description: module bundler that is simple to configure but has enough features to be a valid alternative to WebPack

name: Jasmine
description: an open-source testing framework for JavaScript

name: Hotjar
description: a software tool to track users

name: Piwik
description: a tool to track a customer's behavior across websites and apps

name: TypeScript
description: in larger applications, the preferred way to program in JavaScript

name: Jest
description: a JavaScript testing framework like Mocha, but simpler

name: Git
description: the most-used revision control system today

name: Next.js
description: a React framework that enables server-side rendering

name: NestJS
description: a Node.js framework for building efficient, reliable and scalable server-side applications

name: Responsive web design
description: an approach to web design that aims to make web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes from minimum to maximum display size to ensure usability and satisfaction

name: PWA
description: Progresssive Web App - application software delivered through the web

name: HTML
description: the markup language that serves as the basis of websites

name: CSS
description: the language used to style websites and a standard tool for web development

name: JavaScript
description: the main scripting language of the Web

name: Mocha
description: one of the most popular JavaScript testing frameworks

name: Vue.js
description: can easily be used to enhance existing applications as well as to create new applications

name: MVC
description: an architectural pattern commonly used particularly in web development

name: C
description: low-level language used to program everything from hardware devices to operating systems

name: C++
description: low-level language for writing applications

name: Java
description: a popular and ubiquitious OOP programming language

name: C#
description: the standard OOP language on the .NET platform

name: MVVM
description: a pattern like MVC but with a View Model, gave rise to JavaScript frameworks

name: Azure
description: a cloud computing service created by Microsoft for building, testing, deploying, and managing applications and services

name: AWS
description: a subsidiary of Amazon that provides on-demand cloud computing platforms

name: GCP
description: a suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products, such as Google Search, Gmail and YouTube

name: SQL
description: the standard language you use to get data from relational databases

name: NoSQL
description: a type of non-table database used with big data

name: SAP
description: a German software company and world's leading enterprise resource planning (ERP) software vendor

name: XML
description: markup language for defining and transmitting data and documents

name: JSON
description: a popular standard for storing and transmitting information and data objects, particularly in JavaScript

name: Agile
description: a philosophy of software developer which includes adaptive planning, evolutionary development, early delivery, continual improvement, and flexible responses to changes in requirements, capacity, and understanding of the problems to be solved

name: Scrum
description: a framework for project management designed for teams of ten or fewer members who break their work into goals that can be completed within time-boxed iterations, called sprints, no longer than one month and most commonly two weeks

name: Gitflow
description: a branching and merging methodology popularized by the blog post "A Successful Git branching model", older, seems overly complicated and controversial

name: Domain-Driven Design
description: a software design approach focused on modeling software to match a domain according to input from that domain's experts

name: Microservices
description: an architectural pattern that arranges an application as a collection of loosely-coupled, fine-grained services, communicating through lightweight protocols, one goal being that teams can develop and deploy their services independently of others

name: .NET
description: the main Windows development framework since 2001

name: Entity Framework
description: object-relational mapping (ORM) framework for .NET

name: Hangfire
description: easy way to perform background processing in .NET and .NET Core applications

name: RabbitMQ
description: message-broker software that originally implemented AMQP

name: MUI
description: Material UI - React components for faster and easier web development

name: GraphQL
description: a newer and more robust alternative to REST

name: Apollo
description: the most popular GraphQL client

name: ASP.NET
description: the Microsoft .NET standard approach for developing websites

name: Docker
description: a software virtualization solution that allows each application to run in a separate container

name: Kubernetes
description: platform used for large-scale application automation including Docker

name: OpenShift
description: a family of containerization software products developed by Red Hat, similar to Kubernets

name: NUnit
description: an open-source unit testing framework for the .NET Framework and Mono

name: Rider
description: a cross-platform IDE for .NET by JetBrains

name: DevOps Server
description: an Azure tool to share code, track work, and ship software using integrated software delivery tools, hosted on-premises

name: MongoDB
description: the most popular NoSQL document store database

name: cloud computing
description: on-demand and scalable availability of computer system resources, usually AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform

name: Kotlin
description: Google's new Java language

name: Swift
description: Apple's general-purpose, multi-paradigm, compiled programming language, developed as a replacement for Apple's earlier programming language Objective-C

name: Jetpack Compose
description: Android's recommended modern toolkit for building native UI

name: Firebase
description: a platform developed by Google for creating mobile and web applications

name: Flutter
description: Google's software development kit for mobile apps

name: Dart
description: a Google replacement for JavaScript which transpiles to JavaScript

name: Node
description: central JavaScript technology for web backend and application development

name: Express
description: a web application framework for Node.js and the de facto Node standard for building web applications and APIs

name: Magento
description: an e-commerce PHP framework created in 2008, now owned by Adobe

name: JQuery
description: a useful and popular but older JavaScript library

name: PHP
description: very popular and pragmatic programming language for websites

name: MySQL
description: a very popular and widespread database for websites and applications

name: Apache
description: a old, classic and popular web server from the 90s

name: nginx
description: a fast web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache

name: Webpack
description: the most popular JavaScript module bundler

name: WebStorm
description: an integrated development environment for JavaScript and related technologies

name: Rollup
description: the second most popular module bundler for JavaScript

name: MINT
description: Bezeichnung von und Studienfächern aus den Bereichen Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaft und Technik, auf Englisch STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics)

name: machine learning
description: a part of artificial intelligence, ML algorithms build a model based on sample data, known as training data, in order to make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed to do so

name: Python
description: an older but pragmatic language and increasingly popular today used widely by scientists and mathematicians

name: Python Science Stack
description: a set of libraries for scientific computation and visualization including Python, NumPy, SciPy, matplotlib, IPython, pandas, SymPy and Jupyter Notebook

name: scikit-learn
description: a set of simple and efficient tools for predictive data analysis built on NumPy, SciPy and matplotlib

name: OOP
description: (Object-Oriented Programming) a programming paradigm based on the concept of objects, which can contain data and code, the data is in the form of properties and the code is in the form of methods, contrast with functional programming

name: Tensorflow
description: Google Brain's second-generation system focus on training and inference of deep neural networks

name: PyTorch
description: a machine learning framework based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing
